intro: Patrinia dielsii var. erosa, commonly known as the hairy patrinia, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
